channel.title: Useful methods for Stream class
channel.description:
Allows reading and writing to files to and from the buffer, respectively. writing to file requires more arguments, because it needs to know the parameters of your situation (write buffer.length || currentOffset && append To File or overwrite it?
[url=http://pastebin.com/4pX5HmrJ]http://pastebin.com/4pX5HmrJ[/url]

item.title: Useful methods for Stream class
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

sinisoul:

Eh, I suggest (I use the word suggest) that instead of putting this in the stream class you move it to a separate class for file utilities to append a byte array to a file or use the RAF class and just write it.

okay, i would be passing my stream class as a parameter for convenience.
Stream is a stream,no matter where you write it too or read it from. It is in its self a convenience class that allows you quick writing of variable-length(write(byte,word,dword,qword…string)) byte arrays to an included byte array. (buffer)
The parameters on my methods are there in case you want a distinct file size for your file. (even if the byte’s are all 0’s)
The “stream” of this file is “buffer”, which is no different than FileOutputStream (FOS) or FileInputStream(FIS) use.
the write method for them, use byte arrays.

new FileInputStream(File*).write(byte[]*)
*
File to read from
buffer to read too.

Tell me at what point of putting these in another class becomes more convenient/efficient than this?
The same thing could be done for the stream to the server. (Just choose where to write them too!)

Read full topic

item.title: Useful methods for Stream class
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

“append To File or overwrite it?”

The append parameter for the FOS is used to denote whether or not to put the buffer to the beginning or the end of the file

Java Doc

Read full topic

item.title: Useful methods for Stream class
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

I do a lot of client sided cache related stuff. I created file reader/writers for compressed game saves saving space and increasing game load and save times. i made it a convenience service.
You can use the stream for more than just server<->client contact. It is a multi-use code that has many applicable scenarios in private servers. (Something you would expect from a multi-million dollar corp.) but if you wont want to use it thats fine too.

Read full topic
